text: Nerd Corps Entertainment was a Canadian animation studio located in Vancouver, British Columbia. Nerd Corps has been world known for Slugterra television series. It airs on Disney XD. DHX Media bought the company for $57 million in December 24, 2014. It became a Subsidiary of DHX Media. Nerd Corps Entertainment is one of the largest children's animation studios in North America. Founded by Asaph Fipke and Chuck Johnson in 2002. Nerd Corps has grown from a small operation working out of an apartment in downtown Vancouver to more than 400 artists and storytellers. ==Productions== ===Television series=== * Dragon Booster (2004―2006) (co-produced with ApolloScreen Filmprodukion, the Story Hat and Alliance Atlantis) * Storm Hawks (2007―2009) * League of Super Evil (2009—2012) * Hot Wheels: Battle Force 5 (2009―2011) (co-produced with Mattel and Nelvana) * Rated A for Awesome (2011―2012) * Slugterra (2012―2016) (continued on as DHX Studios Vancouver) * Max Steel (2013―2014) (co-produced with FremantleMedia Kids & Family and Mattel Playground Productions) * Kate & Mim-Mim (2014―present) (season 1) (co- produced with FremantleMedia Kids & Family in the original series and continued on as DHX Studios Vancouver) * Blaze and the Monster Machines (2014―present) (season 1) (co-produced with Nickelodeon Animation Studio and continued on as DHX Studios Vancouver) * Endangered Species (2015) * The Deep (2015―2022) (co-produced with A Stark Production and BBC Children's Productions, continued on as DHX Studios Vancouver) ===Feature films=== *Monster High: Why Do Ghouls Fall in Love?
